verses.verse: How <S%H4100><s%> beautiful <S%H3303><s%> are your feet <S%H6471><s%> with shoes, <S%H5275><s%> O prince's <S%H5081><s%> daughter! <S%H1323><s%> the joints <S%H2542><s%> of your thighs <S%H3409><s%> are like <S%H3644><s%> jewels, <S%H2484><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of a cunning <S%H542><s%> workman. <S%H542><s%>

Your navel <S%H8326><s%> is like a round <S%H5469><s%> goblet, <S%H101><s%> which wants <S%H2637><s%> not liquor: <S%H4197><s%> your belly <S%H990><s%> is like an heap <S%H6194><s%> of wheat <S%H2406><s%> set <S%H5473><s%> about <S%H5473><s%> with lilies. <S%H7799><s%>
Your two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H6082><s%> roes <S%H6646><s%> that are twins. <S%H8380><s%>

Your neck <S%H6677><s%> is as a tower <S%H4026><s%> of ivory; <S%H8127><s%> your eyes <S%H5869><s%> like the fish pools <S%H1295><s%> in Heshbon, <S%H2809><s%> by the gate <S%H8179><s%> of Bathrabbim: <S%H1337><s%> your nose <S%H639><s%> is as the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> which looks <S%H6822><s%> toward Damascus. <S%H1834><s%>

Your head <S%H7218><s%> on you is like Carmel, <S%H3760><s%> and the hair <S%H1803><s%> of your head <S%H7218><s%> like purple; <S%H713><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> is held <S%H631><s%> in the galleries. <S%H7298><s%>
How <S%H4100><s%> fair <S%H3302><s%> and how <S%H4100><s%> pleasant <S%H5276><s%> are you, O love, <S%H160><s%> for delights! <S%H8588><s%>
This <S%H2063><s%> your stature <S%H6967><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> to a palm <S%H8558><s%> tree, and your breasts <S%H7699><s%> to clusters <S%H811><s%> of grapes.

I said, <S%H559><s%> I will go <S%H5927><s%> up to the palm <S%H8558><s%> tree, I will take <S%H270><s%> hold <S%H270><s%> of the boughs <S%H5577><s%> thereof: now <S%H4994><s%> also your breasts <S%H7699><s%> shall be as clusters <S%H811><s%> of the vine, <S%H1612><s%> and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your nose <S%H639><s%> like apples; <S%H8598><s%>

And the roof <S%H2441><s%> of your mouth <S%H2441><s%> like the best <S%H2896><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> for my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> that goes <S%H1980><s%> down sweetly, <S%H4339><s%> causing the lips <S%H8193><s%> of those that are asleep <S%H3463><s%> to speak. <S%H1680><s%>
I am my beloved's, <S%H1730><s%> and his desire <S%H8669><s%> is toward <S%H5921><s%> me.
Come, <S%H3212><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> let us go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> into the field; <S%H7704><s%> let us lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the villages. <S%H3723><s%>

Let us get up early <S%H7925><s%> to the vineyards; <S%H3754><s%> let us see <S%H7200><s%> if <S%H518><s%> the vine <S%H1612><s%> flourish, <S%H6524><s%> whether the tender grape <S%H5563><s%> appear, <S%H6524><s%> and the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> bud <S%H5132><s%> forth: <S%H5132><s%> there will I give <S%H5414><s%> you my loves. <S%H1730><s%>

The mandrakes <S%H1736><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> a smell, <S%H7381><s%> and at <S%H5921><s%> our gates <S%H6607><s%> are all <S%H3605><s%> manner of pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits, new <S%H2319><s%> and old, <S%H3465><s%> which I have laid <S%H6845><s%> up for you, O my beloved. <S%H1730><s%>
